A very excellent place for anyone who would like some Chinese food. We are sure to return again.
author: Anthony G.

description: This place is great after two fantastic delivery experiences. The food tastes great and my roommates and I all enjoyed it. Portion sizes are pretty average and the ingredients are fresh. The delivery is FAST. One time I ordered off of Eat24 and my doorbell rang 25 minutes later. How did that even happen?! We will definitely be ordering from here again!
author: Louise Z.

description: I'm a huge fan of the menu here. The mixed drinks however were just so so. If you are going to eat here I would advise booking ahead of time as to not have to wait. This place is always very busy. Good stuff!
author: Joshua B.

description:
We had never been it's new how bad could it be ?
We ordered 6 items yes 6.
3 old friends....None of us can cook.....we are nice to each other..... and to strangers.
BUT not so nice to restaurants.
Not a complaint from the bunch HIGH PRAISE.
author: Roxanne Y.

description:
Wow, this place is great. Just had an amazing lunch. 

I was considering a sandwich at Ike's and the line was so long that I went elsewhere. For almost the same price as an Ike's sandwich I got a super fresh, hot, healthy, and delicious 3 course lunch. In a prompt, spacious, and unrushed atmosphere. 

The neighborhood had better support this place! I've walked by a bunch in the past and it's often empty. Daimaru was here and went out of business. I'm now a supporter and evangelist.
author: Adam M.

description:
Found this place online and placed an order for pickup.

Lunch combination comes with a couple potstickers, a soup, and a main course - I got the house special fried noodles.

The hot and sour soup was excellent - tangy and a slight bit of kick to it. Potstickers were fairly dry and did not impress. The fried noodles hit the spot without feeling too oily or heavy.

Everything is priced very reasonably on their lunch menu, I'd order from here again.
author: Daniel L.

description: Probably the best Chinese food I've had in a while. Ordered chow mein, fried rice, Mongolian beef, and orange chicken. Freshly cooked and delicious.
author: J N.

description: Best Chinese delivery in the Castro. Their House Special Combination Chow Mein is the best Chow Mein I've had. The fried rice is fresh and not too greasy. The Veggie Combo egg noodle soup has Ramen sized noodles, great broth and fresh veggies. Could not recommend more to have delivered to your door.
author: James V.

description: My favorite Chinese restaurant to get delivery. I can always be 100% sure the food will be on time and delicious.
author: Samantha K.

description:
You guys need to eat here. The food and service are great but I've never seen it crowded so you better start picking up the slack. Some of the dishes are a little strange (the lemon chicken kinda tasted like funnel cake) but these have all been authentic and tasty:

* all the dumplings and pancakes
* cod in black bean sauce
* eggplant in clay pot
* chicken corn soup
* pork fried rice
author: Matt S.

description: I've been to Makli several times and it was a great experience every time . Service and food were both 5/5. So many dishes to recommend but my favorites are the Mongolian beef and salted fish/diced chicken tofu in clay pot. You can't go wrong with either those, and you'll be back for more!
author: Ethan Y.

description: I live down the street from Makli and it took me awhile to check it out.   Finally gave it a try and I am hooked.  It's my go to place for Chinese food in the neighborhood.   Tasty food, authentic dishes and the folks at Makli are really nice.   Oh, their pork fried rice is to die for!
author: G A.

description:
really, so unassuming...kinda like that.

too tired to fix food, too tired to walk to get it, and my handy (nod to German) is handy, and via seamless.com and a desire for comfort food, just not from this Continent...

ergo, Makli.

I can walk the back alleys of Shanghai, I know Cantonese chow, and this place rocks
socks off!

The XO sauced beef is my new 'must have' favorite. So deep in flavors, so very, very good.

Pick any dumpling, we chose 4 and everyone was excellent, and we're talking Delivered Food here. Must be a knock-out live.

so, genug, enough, stop reading, go eat here. 'nuff.

Enjoy!
author: William M.

description: Solid Chinese food.  Great potstickers and Mu Shu.  The cod dish was bland, but overall, it was pretty good.  I'd eat there again
author: Michael D.

description:
Really good lunch special you get a lot of food everything we had was flavorful and of high quality. Mongolian beef with spicy but good and the eggplant veggie dish was good but a little saucy maybe.

Looking forward to using these guys for delivery since there isn't a lot of good delivery in this area.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
I was compelled to write a review for Makli because their Lemon Chicken was the STRANGEST dish I've EVER tasted in a Chinese restaurant. The plain chicken breast is battered and deep-fried, then smothered in an intensely sweet, candy-like, bright yellow sauce. Sauce that seemed better suited atop ice cream, not meat. It didn't taste bad, per se, but it was certainly in no way typical Chinese cuisine.

I think this dish can only be properly described as "carnival fare." It's something I would expect to see served up next to some funnel cake, deep-fried Twinkies, and chocolate-covered bacon. Not with a side of rice in a Chinese restaurant! My friends and I were so confused (and intrigued) by this dish that we purposefully packed some of it up to take home and give to other people to try.

Everything else we ordered was standard.

Our party of three entered the empty restaurant around noon Sunday because Kitchen Story across the street was packed (as was probably every other brunch-serving establishment in the Castro). Our egg drop soup, pork dumplings, spring rolls, Yangzhou/House Special fried rice, and shrimp chow mein were all fine, though consistently underseasoned. Whether this reflects the chef's personal taste, or our fitness-conscious neighborhood's, I do not know.

I give them three stars, because Yelp says that equates to "A-OK," which describes my feelings perfectly. I was satisfied, and I got my money's worth ($8.95 lunch special).

FINAL TIP: Be sure to laugh at the menu, which misspells "Dumpling" as "Dumping," in every instance of the word. It's a tradition at this restaurant now: The couple that came in after us laughed at "steamed dumping," too.
author: Andrew S.

description: Didn't want to give this place a review because it is a hidden secret in the Castro.  I am picky with Chinese food and yes, this is not the best Chinese food around in SF but it is above average and better than decent in the Castro.  The dishes are authentic, but they can definitely do better with the potstickers.  I tried their Mae Po Tofu, eggplants with shredded pork, walnut shrimp, broccoli beef, minced beef and egg soup and other dishes.  The price is decent comparing to other Asian restaurants in the same area.  It is nothing fancy but comfortable. The lady server always tries to do her best to serve.  I've been there three times and will go back.
author: Sfscubaman T.

description: It's a very nice and neat Chinese restaurant. The food is amazing. I've been there many times. Salty chicken with tofu, Mapo Tofu, green bean, Scallop with sweet and sour source are my favorites.
author: Miya Z.

description:
Stopped in on a Wed at 5:30pm and it was dead. Got the codfish in black bean sauce and was very pleasantly surprised by the sweet red onion, the bell peppers and the slight peppery kick of the delicious black bean sauce. Their sauce is their strong point.
I was also told that they use NO MSG!

Very nice and simple. I added some ginger to it once I got home, on the side. 
I did ask the gal there what is their specialty and she said the spicy Ma Po tofu, so heads up, tofu lovers.

PROS: Great pan technique and spicy kick; Freshly made and good sincere customer service. Much better ambience than Red Jade since it is far less busy and the food tastes much fresher. 

CONS: To-Go ware is the clear plastic kind that I always worry about, not the cardboard to-go Chinese food take out boxes that Red Jade uses.
author: Nan L.

description:
Haven't reviewed in a long time but this neighborhood, family-run business is worthwhile to do so!

The most authentic Chinese cuisine in the MIssion / Castro area.

Ordered delivery twice and dined in once - service overall is always great (hot, quality food and great staff .. super hospitable). The restaurant itself is very welcoming with homey / quirky decor. The menu is extensive (dim sum, soups, usual entrees, etc.) so lots to try. Random note - their pre-packaged fortune cookies are always the freshest.

Definitely recommended for both delivery and dine in.
author: Ems K.

description: Best Chinese food in the Castro. They have really good General Tso's chicken. The decor is not great however. It could use some improvements, but the food is good quality. I've eaten there around six times. They have lunch specials also. Not a place I'd take people to because of the decor.
author: David H.

description:
Great neighborhood option. Never busy, but the food is some of the most reliable Chinese I've had in the Castro. 
Excellent sauces have made every dish I've had here delicious. 
Will be going back often to work through more of the menu.
author: Q C.

description:
I have ended my search for a great Chinese restaurant in the Castro.  Makli is my place now.

I ordered Mongolian beef.  Superb.  It's literally all tender and deep flavored beef.  The flavor and heat level were perfect.  And just enough bell pepper and onion for some crunch.  But the dish is primarily large pieces of tender beef.
author: Mary H.

description: Good is fresh and staff is always friendly and serve with a smile. Lunch special is great value and I highly recommend.
author: Aaron S.

description: Best Chinese Food In SF Bay Area!!! Awesome Service & Amazing Everything! Full Of Deliciousness On Every Plate!!! My Favorites Are Endless But I Can Not Resist Their Mouth Savoring Walnut Prawns & BlackBean Sauce CatFish!!! Don't Believe Me?!?! Try It For Your Self!!! You Can Thank Me Afterwards!!! :)
author: Lee A.

description: Shocked how gross this is! Just ordered delivery -- soggy eggrolls, mu shu crepes crumbled in my fingers, general's chicken is soggy fried fry with basically no chicken. There were exploded sauces all over the bag. The nastiest. There is still not a Chinese delivery option in SF unless you use Postmates. Just so gross you can't even believe it. We had one bite of everything and just threw away over $40 of food. How are they in business?
author: Laura W.

description: General Tso's chicken. Shrimp chow mein. Pot stickers.green onion pancake. This place smells wonderful when you walk in the door. Wonderful friendly service. Yummy fresh food.
author: Jane L.

description:
Makli is the authentic Chinese restaurant I've been looking for since I moved to San Francisco!

They have a wide variety of dumplings, their deep fried chicken wings are out of this world, their kung bow chicken is a great dish to take out, and their mushu pork is always made perfectly.

The owner Sam is simply wonderful.  He is attentive to every patron, and so helpful.

This is also a great place for takeout.  The food is ready in less than 10 minutes most of the time and it's such a nice, calm atmosphere, you wouldn't even mind if it took longer.
author: Samantha K.

description:
We came here because we were looking for soup dumplings, but we left very disappointed. The soup dumplings were dry and had almost no soup in them. The Singapore noodles were also very dry with clumps of sauce and over cooked meat. The  fried green beans were over cooked and a bit too salty for my taste. We wouldn't have minded if it was a cheap hole in the wall but it was pretty expensive compared to similar restaurants.

On the plus side the server was nice and they have good blossoming flower tea. Maybe it was on off night as it currently has very good reviews but I would suggest trying somewhere else.
author: Danny O.

description: Ordered delivery. The cod was quite good. I'd say everything else was exactly average for Chinese delivery.
Ordered delivery,  had I been in the restaurant I would have sent the food back.  The spring rolls were undercooked and gross. The chow mein was sticky and bland. Not appetizing or tasty.
author: Tony C.

description: Better than mission chinese. Most authentic chinese restaurant in the mission. Absolutely fantastic service too.
author: Alex P.

description: Absolutely try the hot and sour soup. Best I've ever had. Also the fried rice was fantastic.
author: Brian W.

description: I ordered the veg fried rice,crispy cod and the chicken corn soup. It was very light and tasty. Surprised with the negative reviews. Someone said that they use frozen veges. Mine was fresh and you can tell by the crunch. The server was nice and very attentive. Thanks Makli and don't let the negative reviews keep you from doing a good job. I recommend.
author: Ronald S.

description: Consistently good, fast and convenient take-out or delivery. Have enjoyed every dish I've tried - favorites include dumplings, peking duck buns and general's chicken. Best delivery option in the neighborhood.
author: John C.

description: $35 included 1. wonton soup - wontons had little meat and no taste. 2. Sweet and sour pork - not bad flavor wise, but the job has only half full; terrible portions here for eveything! Like 6 small peices of meat in the whole carton with a bunch of finely chopped vegetable slop. 3.Chow mein - bland. 4. Egg rolls - soft undercooked center; not even crispy.  The only redeeming quality is the weirdly awesome sweet and sour sauce. But not worth it. Never coming back. There are just too many great Chinese food places in the city. I'd recommend skipping it.
author: John B.

description: Fantastic food, quick and hot delivery!  Don't miss the Shanghai soup dumplings and the spareribs with coffee sauce....amazing!
author: Rex M.

description: Attentive service. Food was well balanced: honey walnut prawns were light on the mayo and properly cooked.  Honey seared scallops were really tasty, although the sauce was a bit too thick. Wonton soup (good chicken broth) were very light and the filling was delicate and with good texture. The green onion pancake was nice. Love their flower tea. Instead of the usual fortune cookie, they brought us a nicely served half orange. We left happy.
author: Ollim E.

description: So tasty! We ordered four things for two people and it was perfect. The duck buns were outstanding, and our favorite dish was the BBQ pork fried rice. These guys really need to market themselves better, as you'd have no idea this place is fantastic by their outside appearance. They don't even have a real sign! I can't wait to try it again. Legit Cantonese food in a neighborhood severely lacking in it.
author: Adam K.

description: We've come here a couple of times - staff is friendly, and while the restaurant might seem unassuming, the food is great. The veggies are fresh, the flavors are strong and spot on. Overall a solid chinese place to have right around the corner!
author: Olivier L.

description: For a neighborhood Chinese restaurant this place is different and reliable. The staff is friendly and efficient. The XO BEEF IS A MUST-ORDER. It is super delicious and unlike anything I've seen in other restaurants. Order it extra spicy. The potstickers are like most others but come with a dipping sauce that is fantastic. Singapore noodles are delicious, and something as boring-sounding as curry chicken is also different than you'd expect and delicious.
author: Bill C.

description: Delivered food: greasy. The roast chicken was good but everything else was close to inedible. Worst: pot stickers. I have a dream that someday there will be authentic good Chinese food available through Seamless. That dream does not appear to be coming true.
author: Jane M.

description: Awesome restaurant. The first Chinese restaurant I've been to where the food is realllly close to being authentic. Not too Americanized at all (except for the Chinese-American dishes of course). The menu is very varied, lots of kinds to choose from. Not pricey either. The reatuarant itself is very clean. Cute decoration. Very friendly, courteous, and attentive waitress. Don't let the construction outside deter you away from entering Makli!
author: Lissa S.

description: This place is amazing! Everything we've tried had been perfection. Just experienced the Hot & Sour Soup and it was the best I've ever head. The device is always impeccable and delivery arrives HOT.
author: Travis S.

description: Ordered takeout mu Shu Pork generals chicken.  The food was by far the best I've found in the Castro.  Prices are great!  I'll be back.  Looking forward to trying the lunch specials.
author: Bill B.

description: I've only experienced lunch at Makli, but it's always been very good.  I've eaten in and stopped in for carry out. The food is always fresh. The staff is very nice.    It is not a place I would suggest for a special date night, but for a good Chinese meal I would highly recommend.
author: t m.

description:
There are so few decent Chinese place in the Castro that I really wanted to give this a five star just to help keep them in business, but I really couldn't in good conscience. The four stars given is still a little bit score inflated.

I have ordered take-out here a number of times and the food alway arrived quickly and hot. The quality has always been decent but I typically stuck with take out items that travelled well and are more common. Solid 3-4 stars for take-out

Tonight I dined in for the first time. Definitely more of a neighborhood hole-in-the-wall but super kid-friendly. It helps that the place was practically empty. We ordered 5 things and three of them were pretty good (fried rice, vegetable in broth and lemon chicken). The sweet and sour pork was not great, just a lot of friend dough and the veggies were not complemented well and unevenly cooked. The last item were steamed pork and veggie buns and this was the big disappointment, they were well steamed but have already gone bad and smelled sour. I know that sounds pretty bad but I would like to cut them some slack and hope that the freshness of all ingredients will improve as their popularity improves. Probably a 2-3 star dinner experience.

Really hope this place lasts!
author: Sharon L.

description: Delicious food and great service. Staff is nice and welcoming. I definitely recommend trying this spot!
author: Manuel M.

description: Amazing food and clean place! First of all they have a giant tv which is nice, good music not too loud and they bring you chilled glasses and a chilled, glass  bottle of water for refills. We ordered the hot & sour soup and general tso's chicken. The soup was so good and different, vegetarian too! The chicken was lightly breaded to perfection, all white meat, and not greasy at all. The chili sauce was amazing and overall a wonderful find in the castro. Definitely coming back:)
author: April C.

description: Our order arrived late. We ordered 3 things and all failed: The veggie noodle soup had barely any broth, the noodles were overcooked, and it had no flavor. The braised tofu in a pot entree was also bland, the tofu was very greasy and gross, and even though I did check the box to order rice, we received none, I guess it does not matter since the entree had no sauce. The green onion pancakes were shoved into a tiny box so they were all broken up and also pretty much tasteless. The worst Chinese food I have had in SF.
author: elle s.

description: Not really spectacular food wise. But what do you expect? It's Castro adjacent. Server was very attentive, so that's a big plus. Prices are reasonable, nice lunch special. But if I want better food, I'd rather go to Red Jade on Church Street. But I was happy to see an Asian restaurant in this neighborhood. Hope this place gets better and lasts awhile. I may be back.
author: Jesse B.

description: This is a great neighborhood spot! Pretty cheap and really hits the spot when you get that craving for some Chinese takeout.
author: Matt L.

description: Went there for lunch today. Decent prices for lunch.  $9.95 for Singapore street noodles, hot n sour soup and eggrolls. Very good soup, was little spicy - which I liked. The street noodles had a very good curry taste, was spicy and dry - the way I like it. Didn't like the spring rolls though. Too bready. My husband liked his kung pao chicken. He said it wasn't too sweet, which was good. He got the pot stickers, which were very tasty, and the same soup, which he thought was a bit too sour.  The service was spectacular.  She was very nice. It was a hot day though, so I don't recommend eating all the spicy food on a hot day as the doors were open and there wasn't any AC. If I lived here, I'd be a regular though.
author: K G.

description: You should go here. There aren't enough solid chinese places in the area and this one is great AND cheap. I've been here 3-4 times already... your turn!
author: Taylor S.

description: We ordered orange chicken and she brought out lemon. She took it back and just poured orange sauce over the lemon like we couldn't tell the difference
author: Demonte J.

description: This is our favorite Chinese in the Castro area.  Everything is really fresh and the Peking Duck rolls are fabulous. The serving people are delightful.  Very bright, pleasant restaurant for a simple meal.
author: Carol S.

description: just OK. Food was tasty but a bit salty. Portions were on the smaller side compared to other Chinese places
author: Asher B.

description:
Ok. Had to update my review. Alas, the restaurant is not perfect after all. The hot and sour soup is not great--too much vinegar. It's very tart and tangy with no savory and hot flavors to balance it. Skip it. A few other items have been inconsistent and one time we got a not so fresh seaweed salad--blech! But, it's delicious when it is fresh.

Makli is a new hidden treasure in the neighborhood and definitely worth trying regardless of where you live in San Francisco. 

The walnut prawns are delicate and fresh and the beef broccoli is tender with perfectly cooked vegetables. The cuisine seems more Shanghainese and Cantonese influenced, offering for example, a delicious seaweed salad as an appetizer, yet the spicy dishes have more than adequate heat, which makes it perfect all around.

The delivery service is exceptional. The food arrives quickly, piping hot, and well prepared.
author: Stephen P.

description: I love across the street and enjoy eating here. They have a great lunch special and it's a lot of food. For $9 you get soup, appetizer, and a rice or noodle plate. It's a lot for the price. When I have dinner I enjoy the Honey Beef but for lunch it's the Mongolian Beef.
author: Ryan A.

description:
Went there for lunch take-out (house chow mein). This place is very good.  GIve them a try, it's a much-needed breath of fresh air in the neighborhood.

Months later . . . I've been back now many times, including with family for dinner. Kids are hard to please but even they love the food here.  Food is always excellent; service is always friendly and inviting.  Great Chinese food.    Try it!
author: A. M.

description: DISASTER ONLINE EXPERIENCE!!!!  Looked at all of the Yelp reviews and thought we should give it a try.  We got online and saw the menu and tried their online ordering.  We ordered at 4:00 p.m. this evening.  The confirmation said that we would expect that we would get the order at 5:09 p.m..  We called 5 times (two times were to some 3rd party that we were told to call-who were they??) and finally we received a call from the restaurant at 7:50 (seriously!!!) asking if we had a question!!!  At this point we thought they were kidding.  They had no record of our order, but we had saved our order confirmation as a PDF, if there was need for it for follow up.  So we are calling Red Jade, our tried and true for dinned tonight.  BUYER BEWARE ON THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Chuck A.

description: We were pleasantly surprised by Makli. We went there twice and enjoyed their vegetarian dishes. Highlights - Great food, not busy, and friendly staff! Will certainly be back.
author: Srini S.

description: I'm Chinese n I  live nearby. My partner n I will come to visit at least once a week. The food here is really authentic compare to other restaurants which always have Chinese American Food!
author: Justin H.

description: 40 minutes late with the delivery and after 20 minutes i was throwing up. horrible nasty food. a trash can is a better source of nutrition
author: Ken C.

description: The Chinese food here is really authentic.  I particularly like the Spareribs with coffee sauce.  The rest of the stir fry is tasty. It's definitely a place I'd return to.
author: Baldwin L.

description: I live a block away and have eaten at Makli a bunch of times at this point.  Best Chinese food in the neighborhood.  The veggies are cooked just right.  Still slightly crunchy and not overcooked like the other place that's close by.  The sauces are subtle and very tasty.  Everything seems fresh and tastes like the cook and ingredient buyer actually care about the quality.
author: J s.

description: Poor quality; overcooked veggies; gave wrong noodle dish, not fresh, fried rice bland. Came on time.
author: Harvey S.

description: Yuck.  Just went here for lunch.   My friend sniffed the hot and sour soup and wouldn't eat it.  He thought it smelled of "old dog."  The pot stickers I had were deep fried all around, rather than just on the bottom.  The kung pao chicken was pretty gross.  This is far from an exceptional restaurant.  It's so bad that they had a TV going as a way to distract you from how bad the food is.  A must miss.
author: chad H.

description: Charming, comfortable restaurant with a really fine lunch menu. The food is fresh and well-prepared, and the hot & sour soup is some of the best I can ever remember having. Since they're on a quiet corner, it may take a while for people to find it -- but I hope people do. Makli Restaurant (that's its official name) is new to the neighborhood, and I wish it all the best. (I'll be helping out by eating there regularly.)
author: Scott F.

description: The young man and young woman working at the counter during the pride parade (closing shift) were wonderful. Exceptional customer service.
author: Tea F.

description: i was here with a big group of people and we all agreed that makli's portion sizes were generous and the food tastes pretty good. compared to all the gazillion chinese restaurants in the city, the food is pretty standard but what you won't see is the place crawling with loud chinese families. what i liked about this place is that makli has a smaller, more intimate feel. it is a place where you can enjoy affordable chinese food and a conversation without having to scream over the table. all in all, makli isn't terribly memorable and i wouldn't go out of my way to eat here but if i was in the area, i would definitely consider stopping by to pick up some of their yummy salt and pepper fish.
author: The Hangry Chef O.

description: Lost my online order, when I called after an hour and 45 minutes of waiting, they asked for my address five or six times and then told me it was already out with the driver and it'd be here in 15 minutes. That was 20 minutes ago. Terrible experience.
author: Christopher M.

description: Went last night, cuz of a restaurant.com certificate and proximity to castro theater. AMAZED. food was fresh, service was fast friendly, cute.  Sauces made the difference in tired old standbys like sweet/sour pork; ,chicken w cashews. wonton soup with noodles was HAPPENING. beautiful room, lovely family seems to run it. Low prices; appears there are even lower lunch specials.  we had to hurry, because of movie start time; everything came out fast, fresh.  I had out of town guest, who was thrilled. I, as an old, jaded, seen everything resident, was very pleasantly surprised. dumpling wontons in soup were amazing. hope this place doesn't get TOO much publicity.wont be able to get a seat.  Kicks ass over anything in the Castro or Mission IMHO.
author: William S.

description: Our night started out promising.  Our food and drink order was taken quickly and our drinks arrived in no time.  The five of us ordered two appetizers, four shared plates and one entree.  The spring rolls arrived almost immediately and were delicious.  That's when the good parts ended.  The one entree arrived quite a bit later, along with the rice and one shared dish.  It was another 15 minutes before we received two more shared dishes.  And another 10 minutes before the last one arrived.  That was the house special chow fun.  The noodles were thin rice noodles, nothing like chow fun.  We finally had to ask where the second appetizer was.  It was ready and delivered very quickly which showed that our server forgot it.  After we were finished eating it still took a good 20 minutes to get the check.   And wouldn't have gotten it then had we not asked for it.  There are lots of other options for Chinese food in the neighborhood.  Any one of them is better than this.  I won't go back.
author: Douglas A.

description: I really wanted to not like the place because I miss my regular sushi bar, but the food is too delicious. Makli has won me over! You've got to try it. Everything I've ordered either on-site, or to-go has been awesome, fresh and tasty. Hope the neighborhood supports this little gem.
author: Christopher L.

description: mmm...yummy, soupy dumplings...I think I'm going to get even fatter being so close to this establishment.
author: Philip C.

description: Much better than Red Jade. I'm Chinese American, and it was pretty good.
author: alicia w.
